Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw different habitats, including both land (e.g., playground, garden, forest) and water (e.g., pond, stream, lake) habitats.
The student can illustrate a variety of living things within each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, plants, lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams.
The student can compare and visually represent the diversity of living things across different habitats.
The student can observe and include patterns in how plants and animals exist in their chosen habitats.
The student can clearly organize and label drawings to show the different types of plants and animals observed in each habitat.
